How we work

  1. You can leave a request on our website or call us

  2. We make an appointment at any place convenient for you

  3. At the meeting, over a cup of hot coffee, we approve the layout of the future wedding within your budget

  4. Approve the estimate - sign the contract

  5. Selecting all contractors

  6. Conducting a wedding - control of the entire process, transfer of photo and video material

The Art of Floristry

The Importance of Color, Texture, and Composition

The Importance of Color, Texture, and Composition Floristry is not just about putting flowers in a vase; it is an art form that requires a deep understanding of color, texture, and composition. A skilled florist knows how to mix and match different flowers and foliage to create a cohesive and visually pleasing arrangement. They also take into consideration the occasion and the client's preferences, ensuring that the arrangement reflects the intended message.

Catering to a Diverse Range of Clients

  • From Weddings to Corporate Events:
  • Catering to a Diverse Range of Clients Florists cater to a diverse range of clients, from individuals looking for a simple bouquet of fresh-cut flowers to companies planning elaborate events. Weddings are a popular occasion for floristry, where florists can create custom-designed bouquets, boutonnieres, centerpieces, and ceremony arrangements.
  • Corporate events often require large-scale floral installations, such as floral walls and ceiling installations, to create a memorable and impactful experience for attendees.
  • Florists also provide services for other occasions such as birthdays, anniversaries, and funerals. Whatever the occasion, a skilled florist is dedicated to delivering the perfect floral solution with creativity and expertise.
